title: Big milestone at Heal.dev: we’re now officially SOC 2 Type II compliant! Trust and security have been core to Heal.dev since day one. This type 2 certification by Sensiba LLP validates the rigorous… | Malo Marrec
headline: Big milestone at Heal.dev: we’re now officially SOC 2 Type II compliant!
post_text: Big milestone at Heal.dev : we’re now officially SOC 2 Type II compliant! Trust and security have been core to Heal.dev since day one. This type 2 certification by Sensiba LLP validates the rigorous systems and processes we’ve built to protect customer data and maintain the highest operational standards. Ultimately, software quality is about trust. We're building the best AI QA engineer to find and fix bugs at the speed of codegen. We're super excited to bring it to the most demanding teams! 👏 William Beuil Ferdinand Legros

top_visible_comments.user_title: Co-founder at heal.dev. Building a QA engineer.
Lead designer and design manager, developer, startup advisor.
Applied AI Engineer @Sourcegraph, Ex Product Hunt, ML & AI @IIITB

top_visible_comments.comment: Huge congrats to the Heal.dev team on reaching the SOC 2 milestone! Having gone through that process myself, I know how much grit, late nights, and endless checklists it takes to get there. Massive respect — that’s a real founder endurance test Malo Marrec ;-)
top_visible_comments.user_title: Founder & Tech Entrepreneur | Building Future-Proof Software Solutions | AI & Engineering Expert | Investor | 2x Startup Veteran

post_text_html:
Big milestone at Heal.dev: we’re now officially SOC 2 Type II compliant!

Trust and security have been core to Heal.dev since day one. This type 2 certification by Sensiba LLP validates the rigorous systems and processes we’ve built to protect customer data and maintain the highest operational standards.

Ultimately, software quality is about trust. We're building the best AI QA engineer to find and fix bugs at the speed of codegen. We're super excited to bring it to the most demanding teams!

👏 William Beuil Ferdinand Legros
user_title: Co-founder at heal.dev. Building a QA engineer.
